intro: Astragalus crescenticarpus, commonly known as the crescentpod milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, crescent-shaped seed pods. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It produces small, yellow to pale green flowers that bloom in early summer. The species is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its ecological role in stabilizing soils in harsh environments.
